input.label:
1.1.9 Preparedness Components
Please indicate the degree to which you agree or disagree with the following statements, using a scale where "5" represents strongly agree and "1" represents strongly disagree.

Instructions to enumerator: USE SHOW CARD

select1.label: 1.1.9.1 All staff have been properly informed about the transition from Aphia Program support
1.1.9.2 Our facility was able to communicate adequately with our patients and communities about shifts in service related to transition
1.1.9.3 All health workers that perviously were hired or paid by the Aphia Program were retained at this facility in their same post
1.1.9.4 Our facility did not have to change the way HIV services were delivered as a result of transition
1.1.9.5 Our facility did not have to change the way services for Key Populations are delivered as a result of transition
1.1.9.6 Our facility did not have to change the way Maternal, Neonatal and Child Health services are delivered as a result of transition
1.1.9.7 Our facility had to coordinate with neighboring facilities about filling gaps in services as a result of transition
1.1.9.8 Our facility did not have to change reporting mechanisms as a result of transition
1.1.9.9 Our facility was adequately prepared to transition from Aphia Program support
1.1.9.10 Our facility <u>management and leadership</u> were equipped with sufficient knowledge and skills to prepare for the transition
1.1.9.11 Our facility <u>staff</u> were equipped with sufficient knowledge and skills to prepare for the transition
1.1.10 Has there ever been any suggestion, from your IP, or from government that you might in the future lose support from the Aphia Program?
1.1.11 If yes, do you have a strategy to help you prepare for the potential withdrawal of Aphia Program support?
1.1.12 Have you ever received any support (i.e. training, technical assistance, cash support, other) to prepare the facility for (potential) transition?
1.1.12.1 Did you receive ?

select.label: 1.1.12.2 From whom did you receive the support? Select ALL that apply

item.label: USAID or other USG agency (e.g. Capacity)
NGO or company that owns facility
Association to which facility belongs (eg. Church/Muslim Medical Association)

Section 1.2 Impact of Transition on Key Services


I am going to read out a series of statements, I would like you to complete these sentences for me using a scale of 1-5, where 1 = got much worse, 2 = got worse, 3 = stayed the same, 4 = got better, 5 = got much better

Instructions to enumerator: USE SHOW CARD

select.label:
Enumerator Instructions: Show the list to the respondent, and ask them to select their top 3 concerns. DO NOT SELECT MORE THAN 3 OPTIONS.

1.3 What are your TOP 3 biggest concerns about the effects of the (possible) withdrawal of APHIA Program support to this facility?

item.label: Lack of support for support groups
Lack of technical assistance (e.g. training on new guidelines)
Lack of tools (e.g. registers, forms, stationary)

input.label: Section 1.4: Impact of transition on facility operations

I am going to read out a series of statements about how the withdrawal of APHIA Program support to this facility might affect facility operations. For each statement I would like you to tell me whether:
1- the effect has already occurred
2- the effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3- You don't expect this effect to occur
4- You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

Instructions to enumerator: USE SHOW CARD

select1.label: 1.4.1 Staff spend less time in trainings required by the APHIA program and will have more time to focus on patient services or other health facility activities

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.2 Staff have more time to spend on MNCH services

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.3 County Health Office provides the support needed for support supervision, mentoring staff etc.

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.4 County health officers or facility management are more engaged in day-to-day facility operations?

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.5 Staff spend less time on HIV services

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.6 Delays occur in DHIS2 or iHRIS data submission

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.7 Delays occur in drug and supply orders

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.8 There are stock outs in lab/unable to run tests

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.9 Lack of access to specialized testing due to loss of support for transport

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.10 Inability to attend trainings/cascade learnings

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.11 Loss of volunteers and contract staff

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.12 Loss of staff through their resignation, or reassignment to other health facilities

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so

4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

select1.label: 1.4.13 Increased absenteeism among staff due to loss of incentives

item.label: 2: The effect has not yet occurred but you expect it to do so
3: You don't expect this effect to occur
4: You don't know whether the effect is likely to occur or not

Section 5.1 Current Staffing


Instructions to Enumerator:

1. Please address questions to facility in-charge

2. Request the names of all staff who provide HIV services. Ask the respondent to list all clinical HIV staff one-by-one, including volunteers and lay counselors.

3. Document each individual staff member who provides HIV services, INCLUDING THE FACILITY IN-CHARGE

Section 5.1 Current Staffing


Instructions to Enumerator:
1. Please address questions to the in-charge of the CCC clinic.

2. Request the names of all staff who provide HIV services. Ask the respondent to list all clinical staff that work in the CCC outpatient clinics, including volunteers and lay counselors.

3. Document each individual staff member who provides HIV services, INCLUDING THE CCC CLINIC IN-CHARGE

Direct Budget and Revenue Figures:

Instructions to Enumerator: Ask to see the facility financial records and complete these tables based on the records in consultation with the respondent.

Section 6.1: Facility Budget



We will now discuss the facilities finances and budget. Please note that this is NOT an audit, we are asking to inform our understanding of how support to the facility has changed.

6.1.1 What is the facility budget for the current fiscal/budget year? Enter response in Kenyan shillings

Instructions to enumerator: If unknown, enter 0.01

6.1.2 What are the dates for the current fiscal/budget year?

Note to enumerator: Current Kenyan fiscal year is July 1 2016-June 30 2017/ Provide hint to respondent if they are unsure.

6.1.3 What is the facility budget for the previous fiscal/budget year? Enter response in Kenyan shillings

Instructions to enumerator: If unknown, enter 0.01

6.1.2 What are the dates for the previous fiscal/budget year?

Note to enumerator: Previous Kenyan fiscal year is July 1 2015-June 30 2016. Provide hint to respondent if they are unsure.

select1.label: Would you like to provide your answer by month or by fiscal quarter?

input.label:
6.2.1 What amount was actually released to the facility in ? Enter your response in Kenyan shillings.

Instructions to enumerator: If unknown, enter 0.01

6.2.2 Of this amount, how much was received from each of the following sources?

Instructions to enumerator: If no funding was received from a source, enter 0. If the amount received is unknown, enter 0.01
Other Donor (e.g. Unicef, Global Fund, JICA, Danida, World Bank, other country governments, UN agences)

Instructions to enumerator: If the total from each source is different from the total amount received for the quarter, ask the respondent if they would like to review their responses. If they are not able to identify the discrepancy, then proceed onto the next quarter.

The total amount from each source adds up to KSH, which is not the same as the total amount released to the facility. Would you like to go back and review the answers?

6.2.1 What amount was actually released to the facility in ? Enter your response in Kenyan shillings.

Instructions to enumerator: If unknown, enter 0.01

6.2.2 Of this amount, how much was received from each of the following sources?

Instructions to enumerator: If no funding was received from a source, enter 0. If the amount received is unknown, enter 0.01
Other Donor (e.g. Unicef, Global Fund, JICA, Danida, World Bank, other country governments, UN agences)

Instructions to enumerator: If the total from each source is different from the total amount received for the month, ask the respondent if they would like to review their responses. If they are not able to identify the discrepancy, then procee.

The total amount from each source adds up to KSH, which is not the same as the total amount released to the facility. Would you like to go back and review the answers?

select1.label: Would you like to provide your answer by month or by fiscal quarter?
